Events that occurred on 29 July

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1938 - E.V. Gordon, a later colleague of Tolkien, dies.
1954 - The Fellowship of the Ring is published.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Michael Tolkien, partly published as Letter 289.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Max Rouslin
1985 - Mythcon 16 in Wheaton, Illinois.
1988 - Mythcon 19 in Berkeley, California.
1989 - Mythcon 20 at University of British Columbia, Vancouver.
1991 - Mythcon 22 in San Diego, California.
1994 - Tyalië Tyelelliéva issue 1 is published.
1996 - Mythcon 27 at University of Colorado in Boulder, Colorado.
2002 - Mythcon 33 at Boulder, Colorado.
2004 - Mythcon 35 at University of Michigan in Ann Arbor.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony at Heinz Hall in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
2006 - ELF 2006 in Secaucus, New Jersey.
2006 - The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Legions of Middle-earth is published.
2007 - MerpCon III in Spokane, Washington.
2008 - The 1968 radio series of The Hobbit is re-released in the USA including interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien.
2014 - Producer and interviewer Denys Gueroult dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The funeral procession of king Théoden travels toward Edoras
